title.narrative: GEF Africa Sustainable Forestry Fund, L.P.

description.narrative: A majority of the target countries of the Fund are among the 20% least developed countries in the world. These countries are predominantly rural, with low income levels, low education rates, high infant mortality rates, high HIV prevalence (especially in Southern Africa), poor availability of clean water and nutritious food, and low life expectancy rates. In the face of great need, forestry enterprises in rural areas of Africa will have a significant positive impact. Employment: The investments in the Fund pipeline would create approximately 10,000 new jobs. Community Benefits: Existing GEF funds have provided at least some portion of their employees not only housing, but also health and nutrition services, on-the-job training and support for local schools and communities. The Fund is expected to make a similar commitment to investing in the basic needs of employees and their communities. Sustainable Forestry: The Fund will ensure that all forestry investments will meet the Forest Stewardship Councils Principles and Criteria. With the exception of South Africa, where FSC Certification is already standard practice, additional certification will provide benefits and an important model for the forest sector in all countries targeted by this Project. Climate Change Mitigation: The Fund anticipates investing in 750,000 hectares of forest during its life and estimates the CO2 sequestration of the project to be approximately 4.5 million tons CO2 equivalent per annum, or 44.6 million tons CO2 equivalent for 10 years.

The proposed project involves a US$20 million IFC investment in a fund (the Project) managed by the GEF Management Corporation (GEF or the Sponsor), a leading manager of forestry assets in emerging markets. GEF Africa Sustainable Forestry Fund, L.P., (GEF Africa or the Fund), a limited partnership organized under the laws of the Province of Alberta, Canada, is a $150 million, 12-year closed-end private equity fund dedicated to investments in forestlands or forestry-related companies and projects in Eastern and Southern Africa together with two countries in West Africa.

name.narrative: The Fund will invest in companies mainly in Eastern and Southern Africa together with a few countries in West Africa. The Fund will make equity investments ranging from $15-30 million per company and seeks diversification in the following sub-sectors across the forest sector i) greenfield plantations, ii) existing plantations, iii) natural forest concessions, iv) forest products processing and manufacturing facilities, and v) biomass cogeneration facilities.
